title: Should we believe in the stories about Prophet Sheeth Seth if it is not backed by the Quran & Sunnah
transcript:
we go to our callers brother [Questioner] from 
the U.S so Sheikh um I've been watching countless   videos on a particular Prophet named sheet or Seth 
Prophet (Peace and Blessings Upon Him) Islamic   preachers like Mufti menk and others have 
spoken about how during the prophet seths   time shaytan came and manufactured the world's 
first instruments essentially and also about   how the prophet seth received 50 Chronicles 
out of the 104 that have been sent to mankind   by God they also mentioned how partying and zina 
originated as forms of fitna during the time of   the Prophet Seth now Sheikh this is personally one 
of my favorite prophetic stories but I'm not sure   if these stories are authentic I know that the 
prophet seth isn't mentioned in the Quran and that   he really isn't mentioning the Hadith as far as I 
know so my question to you is should we as Muslims   consider these stories true even though to my 
limited knowledge we don't really have the Quran   and soon not confirming that most of this stuff 
really did happen during the prophet seth time there are so many stories and fables about 
prophets and messengers of Allah azzawajal   it's Muslims our religion is not about 
stories our religion is about Quran and Sunnah   and there is a very tiny window it's very small 
where the Prophet told us whatever you hear   from the tales of the sons of Israel from the Jews 
through old scriptures and they don't go against   Quran and Sunnah don't believe them and don't 
label them as false just keep them as they are   but don't take any rulings 
from them it's just a story   now this is a very tiny window 
which may make 1.01 percent nowadays people are so engaged in such stories 
and tales and you never know they love dragons   and they love Sorcerers this is why they watch 
all of these novels and and movies about them   but they are not related to Islam so whether 
Seth is a prophet or not to my knowledge   I don't know so I would say that I believe in 
all prophets and Messengers generally speaking   but those who are not mentioned in the Quran 
and Sunnah I would not go out of my way to say   that Danial for example is a messenger or 
prophet because I don't know yosha is not   a prophet because I don't know we don't have a 
confirmed evidence backing it up and therefore   as a Muslim I believe that whatever benefits 
us is found in the Quran Sunnah anything else   is elective is not mandatory so we don't spend 
time and build uh uh castles of sand over   stories that are not authentic or do not have any 
credibility so I advise you to ignore all these   stories and focus on learning your religion 
and the seerah of the prophet Prophet (Peace   and Blessings Upon Him)
